verse_commentaries.commentary: Opens with rare superscription 'תְּהִלָּה' (tehillah) - 'song of praise' - unique in Psalter. The verb 'אֲרוֹמִמְךָ' (aromimka) suggests physical elevation/exaltation. Interesting juxtaposition of 'my God' (personal) with 'the king' (cosmic).
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Establishes personal-to-universal frame from thesis
verse_commentaries.phonetic_transcription: təhilāh lədhāwidh 'arwōmimkhā 'elwōhay hamelekh wa'avārəkhāh shimkhā ləʿwōlām wāʿedh

verse_commentaries.commentary: Emphatic 'בְּכׇל־יוֹם' (every single day) - distributive force. Parallel verbs 'bless/praise' with identical temporal phrase creates rhythmic doubling. The repetition of 'forever and ever' from v1 is immediate reinforcement.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Supports temporal extension theme in thesis

verse_commentaries.commentary: Paradoxical structure: declares God's greatness while simultaneously declaring it incomprehensible. 'מְהֻלָּל מְאֹד' (much acclaimed) - intensive praise language. 'אֵין חֵקֶר' (no investigation/searching) - epistemological limit.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Establishes divine transcendence foundation for thesis
verse_commentaries.phonetic_transcription: gādhwōl yəhōwāh wumhulāl mə'ōdh wəlighdhulāthwō 'ēyn khēqer

verse_commentaries.commentary: Generational formula 'דּוֹר לְדוֹר' - transmission language. Two parallel objects: 'works' (מַעֲשֶׂיךָ) vs 'mighty acts' (גְּבוּרֹתֶיךָ) - different categories of divine action. Shift from singular 'I' to plural 'they'.
figurative_analysis: works vs mighty acts - creation vs intervention?
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Central to thesis about intergenerational transmission
verse_commentaries.phonetic_transcription: duwōr lədhwōr yəshabakh maʿaseykhā wughvwurōtheykhā yagiydhwu

verse_commentaries.commentary: Triple accumulation 'הֲדַר כְּבוֹד הוֹדֶךָ' - splendor/glory/majesty - poetic excess or semantic distinction? Returns to first person 'אָשִׂיחָה' (I will recite/meditate). 'נִפְלְאֹתֶיךָ' - wondrous acts, different from v4's categories.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Personal engagement with divine works, supporting thesis

verse_commentaries.commentary: Textual variant: Qere/Ketiv on 'greatness' - suggests scribal uncertainty. 'נוֹרְאֹתֶיךָ' (awesome deeds) - fourth category of divine acts. Mixed persons: 'they shall say' vs 'I will recount'.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Interesting independent of thesis: textual transmission issues

verse_commentaries.commentary: 'זֵכֶר רַב־טוּבְךָ' - memory/remembrance of abundant goodness. Verbs 'יַבִּיעוּ' (bubble forth/gush) and 'יְרַנֵּנוּ' (sing joyously) - liquid and musical metaphors combined. 'צִדְקָתְךָ' - righteousness as praiseworthy.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Supports expanding praise theme from thesis

verse_commentaries.commentary: Classic divine epithet formula from Exodus 34:6. 'חַנּוּן וְרַחוּם' - gracious and compassionate. 'אֶרֶךְ אַפַּיִם' - literally 'long of nostrils' - anthropomorphic anger imagery. Traditional covenantal language.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Provides character foundation for universal mercy in thesis

verse_commentaries.commentary: Universal scope explicit: 'לַכֹּל' (to all). 'וְרַחֲמָיו עַל־כׇּל־מַעֲשָׂיו' - mercy upon ALL His works - radical inclusivity. Moves beyond covenant community to all creation.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Critical for thesis about expanding to cosmic praise

verse_commentaries.commentary: Shift to third person address - 'all Your works shall praise You'. Creates cosmic choir concept. 'חֲסִידֶיךָ' (faithful ones) - specific group within universal works. Two-tier praise structure.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Central to thesis about universal participation in praise

verse_commentaries.commentary: Royal language intensifies: 'כְּבוֹד מַלְכוּתְךָ' (glory of Your kingship). Parallel verbs 'speak/talk' - conversational praise. Kingdom becomes topic of human discourse.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Royal theology central to thesis framework

verse_commentaries.commentary: Purpose clause: 'לְהוֹדִיעַ לִבְנֵי הָאָדָם' - to make known to humanity. Pedagogical function explicit. 'בְנֵי הָאָדָם' - sons of mankind, universal human scope.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Supports thesis about pedagogical transmission
verse_commentaries.phonetic_transcription: ləhwōdhiyʿa  livnēy hā'ādhām gəvwurōthāyw wukhvwōdh hadhar malkhwuthwō

verse_commentaries.commentary: Ugaritic parallel formula! 'מַלְכוּת כׇּל־עֹלָמִים' - kingdom of all ages. LXX adds extra line not in Hebrew MT. This is the theological climax - eternal universal kingship.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Climactic royal theology statement supporting thesis
verse_commentaries.phonetic_transcription: malkhwuthkhā malkhwuth kul-ʿōlāmiym wumemshaltkhā bəkhl-duwōr wādhōr

verse_commentaries.commentary: Concrete care begins - supports 'falling' and 'bent' ones. Physical verbs: 'סוֹמֵךְ' (supports) and 'זוֹקֵף' (straightens). God as physical helper. May correspond to missing nun verse in acrostic.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Divine care demonstrates character that generates praise (thesis)

verse_commentaries.commentary: 'עֵינֵי־כֹל' - eyes of all - visual expectation imagery. 'יְשַׂבֵּרוּ' - hope/wait - temporal tension. 'בְּעִתּוֹ' - in its time - divine timing sovereignty. Creation as dependent looking up.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Universal dependence motivates universal praise (thesis)

verse_commentaries.commentary: 'פּוֹתֵחַ אֶת־יָדֶךָ' - opening Your hand - simple gesture, universal provision. 'מַשְׂבִּיעַ לְכׇל־חַי רָצוֹן' - satisfying every living thing's desire. Radical provision claim.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Universal provision generates universal praise (thesis)

verse_commentaries.commentary: 'צַדִּיק' and 'חָסִיד' - righteous and faithful - moral attributes applied to divine ways and works. Universal scope continues with 'בְּכׇל' repetition.
figurative_analysis: ways and works as moral categories
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Divine character consistency supports universal trust (thesis)

verse_commentaries.commentary: 'קָרוֹב' - near/close - spatial intimacy. Double 'call' with condition 'בֶאֱמֶת' - in truth/faithfulness. Divine accessibility with ethical requirement.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Divine accessibility enables universal calling/praising (thesis)
verse_commentaries.phonetic_transcription: qārwōv yəhōwāh ləkhl-qōrə'āyw ləkhōl 'asher yiqrā'uhwu ve'emeth

verse_commentaries.commentary: 'רְצוֹן־יְרֵאָיו' - desire of those who fear Him. Three-step process: fulfill, hear, deliver. 'יְרֵאָיו' - those who fear - specific group within universal scope.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Special relationship with reverent, but still within universal frame

verse_commentaries.commentary: Sharp contrast: guards 'אֹהֲבָיו' (those who love Him) but destroys 'הָרְשָׁעִים' (the wicked). Only explicit judgment language in psalm. Breaks universal harmony.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Tension with thesis - limits to universal scope?

verse_commentaries.commentary: Returns to first person 'פִּי' (my mouth) but expands to 'כׇּל־בָּשָׂר' (all flesh). 'שֵׁם קׇדְשׁוֹ' - His holy name. Completes inclusio with 'forever and ever'. Individual catalyzes universal.
verse_commentaries.thesis_connection: Perfect conclusion to thesis - individual to universal praise expansion
verse_commentaries.phonetic_transcription: təhilath yəhōwāh yədhaber-piy wiyvārēkhə kul-bāsār shēm qdhəshwō ləʿwōlām wāʿedh f

thematic_threads: Acrostic structure with apparent missing nun verse (v14 may compensate)
Progressive expansion: I → generation → all works → all flesh
Intensive use of כל (all/every) - appears 16+ times creating universality drumbeat
Movement from transcendence (vv1-3) through attributes (vv8-9) to concrete care (vv14-20)
Tension between universal mercy (v9) and selective judgment (v20)
Triple divine epithets and glory language suggesting liturgical formulation
Ugaritic royal formula (v13) - Ancient Near Eastern theological borrowing
LXX adds extra line at v13 - early interpretive plus
interesting_questions: Why does the psalm use the unique superscription 'תְּהִלָּה' instead of the common 'מִזְמוֹר'?
What accounts for the apparent missing nun verse in the acrostic structure - scribal error or theological intention?
How does the triple accumulation 'הֲדַר כְּבוֹד הוֹדֶךָ' function - semantic distinction or poetic intensification?
Why does the LXX add an extra line about God's faithfulness after v13?
How do we reconcile universal divine mercy (v9) with the destruction of the wicked (v20)?
What distinguishes 'works' (מַעֲשֶׂיךָ) from 'mighty acts' (גְּבוּרֹתֶיךָ) from 'wondrous acts' (נִפְלְאֹתֶיךָ)?
Does 'all flesh' (כׇּל־בָּשָׂר) in v21 include all living creatures or only humans?
Why combine liquid metaphor (יַבִּיעוּ - gush forth) with musical imagery (יְרַנֵּנוּ - sing) in v7?
What does 'calling in truth' (בֶאֱמֶת) mean as a condition for divine nearness?
synthesis_notes:
LEXICON: Focus on תְּהִלָּה superscription, triple glory terms, categories of divine acts
CONCORDANCE: Track כל usage patterns, Exodus 34:6 formula appearances, royal terminology
TEXTUAL: Investigate LXX plus at v13, Qere/Ketiv variants, acrostic structure issues
FIGURATIVE: Analyze open hand imagery, gushing/singing metaphors, eyes looking up
COMMENTARY: Address universal mercy vs. selective judgment tension, 'all flesh' scope
